report_title: Online Hobby & Craft Supplies Sales in the US
executive_summary: The online hobby and craft supplies industry experienced relatively strong operating conditions over the past five years to 2023, compared to brick-and-mortar counterparts. Revenue from online sales is expected to increase at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 1.8% to reach $13.4 billion in 2023, including 1.8% growth in 2023 alone. Consumer spending grew amid economic recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic. E-commerce sales rose, with more business shifting online due to social distancing guidelines, contributing to revenue growth. However, profit fluctuated but stabilized by 2023. Looking ahead to 2028, revenue is projected to expand at a faster CAGR of 2.3% as the percentage of online business reaches saturation from the pandemic shift.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Outbreak of COVID-19 Disrupted the Economy
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The coronavirus outbreak caused significant economic downturn domestically and globally. Supply chains, manufacturing, and businesses were disrupted by temporary closures aimed at curbing the virus spread. Economic activity practically stopped, with spiking unemployment and declining consumer spending, though the government provided stimulus.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A Rise in Time Spent on Leisure Invigorated Interest in Industry Products
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Amid the pandemic chaos, online craft supply retailers benefited as consumers followed social distancing guidelines. Brick-and-mortar retail struggled while online shopping saw reduced competition. Time spent on leisure rose, increasing demand for industry craft and sewing supplies.
The shift from physical retail to online shopping, already occurring before 2023, significantly benefited online hobby and craft supplies retailers over the prior five years.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: E-COMMERCE WILL TAKE AWAY POTENTIAL BUSINESS FROM BRICK-AND-MORTAR OUTLETS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Technological advances enabled e-commerce platforms to generate more revenue and convenience. Traditional brick-and-mortar stores like Michael's and Hobby Lobby adapted online platforms, but struggle to compete with large players like Amazon's pricing and shipping.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: E-commerce will take away potential business from brick-and-mortar outlets
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: E-commerce sales are expected to continue expanding, benefiting online hobby and craft goods sellers while hindering physical stores. Online business growth is projected to reach saturation, stabilizing after recent fluctuations.

Following the 2020 pandemic recession, the economies are expected to recover over the next five years. Declining unemployment, rising disposable income and consumer spending will likely increase industry revenue. E-commerce activity growth combined with more online business will drive revenue higher.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Amazon Threatens to Take Control of the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The ongoing presence of major player Amazon will benefit revenue but potentially hinder profit and competitive balance. Amazon's competitive pricing and shipping puts pressure on brick-and-mortar and online retailers.

industry_definition: This industry retails sewing and craft supplies, such as fabrics, patterns, yarns, needlework accessories and various other crafting supplies, via the internet. These goods are purchased from domestic and international manufacturers and wholesalers, and then retailed to the general public online.

threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: Online hobby and craft supplies sales include the retail of craft and sewing supplies, including patterns, fabrics, yarns and sewing materials. Over the years to 2023, industry operators have benefited from an expanding economy and a significant rise in the amount of business conducted online.

market_segmentation.segment_description: On average, older members of this group spend more than younger segment members. As many young members are in school or work at entry-level jobs, they typically earn substantially less than their older counterparts, which decreases their discretionary spending. Most of the adult population is between 35 and 54 years old, and this group is the strongest contributor to the e-commerce industry. Business Insider estimates the average shopper in this age group spends nearly $1,800 online, which is the most among the three age groups. Like those in other segments, consumers in this category purchase industry products for their own leisure activities, but may also make purchases for their children's craft projects and costumes for Halloween and school plays.

As the youngest demographic, this consumer segment is the most susceptible to consumer trends related to fashion. An increasing number of people in this age groups have participated in do-it-yourself (DIY) creations of clothes and accessories.

Online shopping is less common for consumers in this demographic, as a result of both a lack of technological familiarity and device access. The shopping habits of these consumers are among the most influential for the industry because they purchase goods in store, which affects trends for online sales. This demographic group's tastes directly shape the activity in online hobby and craft supplies sales.

products_and_services.product_description: Fabrics include both natural and synthetic goods, and are typically used by consumers for activities like apparel making, home decor and quilting projects. Driven by the increasingly popular trend of do-it-yourself (DIY) fashion, consumers are opting to create their own clothes and household decor items, which has boosted their demand for fabrics sold by online hobby and craft supplies retailers.

This segment includes a wide range of hobby goods like themed-collectibles, cards, puzzles and models. Similar to toy sellers, manufacturers of hobby goods are increasingly adopting cartoon and game themes to their hobby offerings to boost sales from collectors. Due the stay-at-home orders at the peak of the COVID-19 outbreak, hobby goods have experienced a boost in demand.

Sewing supplies include, but are not limited to yarns, laces, trimmings, notions and needlework kits. This product segment has remained stable as a share of revenue, but has experienced growth relative to its historical performance as the DIY fashion trend gained more interest.
Other products in the industry include clothing patterns. Products in this segment tend to be seasonal in popularity, and thus sales of specific products vary throughout the year.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Rise in DIY Created a Historical Boost in Demand for Sewing Supplies
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Sewing supplies include, but are not limited to yarns, laces, trimmings, notions and needlework kits. This product segment has remained stable as a share of revenue, but has experienced growth relative to its historical performance as the DIY fashion trend gained more interest.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Hobby Goods Have Grown in Demand During Quarantine
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This segment includes a wide range of hobby goods like themed-collectibles, cards, puzzles and models. Similar to toy sellers, manufacturers of hobby goods are increasingly adopting cartoon and game themes to their hobby offerings to boost sales from collectors. Due the stay-at-home orders at the peak of the COVID-19 outbreak, hobby goods have experienced a boost in demand.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Fabrics Make Up the Largest Product Segment
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Fabrics include both natural and synthetic goods, and are typically used by consumers for activities like apparel making, home decor and quilting projects. Driven by the increasingly popular trend of do-it-yourself (DIY) fashion, consumers are opting to create their own clothes and household decor items, which has boosted their demand for fabrics sold by online hobby and craft supplies retailers.

business_locations.location_description: The West is the largest region by establishment. The West region has many ports for imports from Asia, Southeast Asia, and Oceania. California makes up roughly 840 miles of the 1,293-mile Pacific coastline and has several major ports, attracting online hobby and craft supplies retailers.

The Southeast is home to the largest percentage of the US population, expanding retailers' access to a potential labor force. The region is also home to many major trading ports, making it a strategic location for retailers who rely on imports for their products. Florida is the largest state by establishment in the Southeast.

The Mid-Atlantic is the third-largest region by establishment. High incomes, proximity to ports, and a large population with many urban hubs attract online retailers to locate in the region. Because of the dense population in this region, rent costs are often higher, which may deter smaller online retailers from locating within the area.

regulations_points.regulation_description: States can require online sellers to collect state sales tax under South Dakota v. Wayfair Inc.
CDC has released guidelines for businesses in response to COVID-19, subject to change.

basis_points.basis_title: Significant divergence between large and small players
basis_points.basis_description: The industry is characterized by a significant divergence between large players and small operators, with a low level of market share concentration.

basis_points.basis_title: Large brick-and-mortar stores expanding into online market
basis_points.basis_description: Some of the largest brick and mortar hobby and craft supplies stores have aggressively expanded into the market.

basis_points.basis_title: Increased concentration due to M&A activity
basis_points.basis_description: Concentration has increased as a result of greater merger and acquisition activity.

basis_points.basis_title: Amazon's expansion driving economies of scale
basis_points.basis_description: In particular, Amazon's expansionary initiatives have been successful and have resulted in the expansion of the company's economies of scale.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Brick-and-mortar stores have increasingly entered the market
The industry is defined by the presence of many of the largest brick and mortar hobby and craft supplies stores, like Michaels and Hobby Lobby, which have aggressively expanded into the market.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top 4 players control less than 25% market share
concentration_points.concentration_description: The diversified online space remains fragmented, with the four largest players controlling less than a quarter of total industry revenue in 2023.
Industry concentration has increased over the five years to 2023 due to merger and acquisition activity alongside foreign penetration of domestic markets.
Established players strategically acquire niche craft stores, specialized suppliers, or innovative startups to strengthen their presence and offer a wider range of products.
Consolidation leads to greater economies of scale, allowing retailers to streamline operations and reducing costs, which benefits both companies and consumers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Marketing tends to represent an important cost for industry operators, as they must market directly to consumers to stand apart from competitors.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patent technologies
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations.
The concentration of technologies is high in this industry, suggesting exposure to unforeseen areas of innovation.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The pandemic created supply chain disruptions like shipping delays and material shortages, affecting availability and cost.
Rapid shifts in consumer preferences and crafting trends can introduce volatility as demand surges and wanes.

FAQs.question: Do your company's advertising campaigns target a wide range of consumers?
FAQs.answer: Company marketing campaigns target consumers of all ages.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators provide a range of products, including craft supplies and sewing materials.

FAQs.question: Have rising input costs negatively affected your company's sales?
FAQs.answer: Rising input costs can cause purchase expenses to rise. Retailers can pass this increase on to consumers, but that can limit demand.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to retain talented employees with specialized knowledge?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators tend to rely on employees with inventory management skills and experience.

FAQs.question: Does your company use point-of-sale (POS) systems to ensure that the most popular products are kept in stock?
FAQs.answer: Companies use POS systems to manage inventory efficiently.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Automation has kept wages as a share of revenue relatively low.

FAQs.question: What does your company do to remain compliant with new consumer regulations?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators tend to ensure they follow protocols regarding consumer data privacy and security.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators ensure employees are not put in situations where their health can be compromised and use equipment when dangers present themselves.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profit varies between online retailers depending on the size and scope of the business.

FAQs.question: Do you have any challenges with customers paying on time?
FAQs.answer: Consumers typically purchase products directly, so accounts receivable are typically not at risk of being collected.

FAQs.question: How do you keep up to date with trends? What seasonal items do you stock, and how well do they sell?
FAQs.answer: Retailing the right product at the right season, like fabrics and patterns for hot weather in the summer, is important to maximize sales.

FAQs.question: What measures do you take to achieve better customer loyalty? How can you cater to customers looking for DIY projects?
FAQs.answer: Operators benefit from developing customer relationships due to the growing competition and consolidation within the industry. For example, DIY seminars hosted virtually and reward programs have been put in place to improve customer loyalty.

FAQs.question: How does time spent on leisure and sports influence demand?
FAQs.answer: Consumers tend to spend more time on hobbies and crafts when they have more downtime. A rise in time spent on leisure and sports benefits hobby and craft retailers.

FAQs.question: How do you monitor changes in consumer spending? How do you plan to adapt to changing incomes?
FAQs.answer: Because industry products are a discretionary purchase for most consumers, a rise in consumer spending will benefit the industry. Conversely, a decrease in consumer spending will hurt the industry.
